```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import geopandas as gpd
import plotnine as p9

# Display message to confirm Python is running
print("Python environment is working correctly!")
```

```{python}
# Load the UNICEF data (update filename if necessary)
df = pd.read_csv(r"C:\Users\ayanc\Downloads\unicef_indicator_2.csv")


# Display the first few rows
print(df.head())
```


```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a bar chart using correct column names
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 5))
plt.bar(df['country'], df['obs_value'], color='pink')  # Correct column name
plt.xlabel('Country')
plt.ylabel('Observed Value')  # Update the label accordingly
plt.title('UNICEF Data Analysis')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.show()

```


```{python}
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 5))
plt.hist(df['obs_value'], bins=20, color='skyblue', edgecolor='black')

plt.xlabel('Observed Value')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Distribution of Observed Values')
plt.show()
```

```{python}
# Group by country and sum the obs_value
top_countries = df.groupby('country')['obs_value'].sum().nlargest(10)

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
top_countries.plot(kind='bar', color='orange')

plt.xlabel('Country')
plt.ylabel('Total Observed Value')
plt.title('Top 10 Countries by Observed Value')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()
```
